statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Here is a simple math. You are given an integer n. Your task is to calculate the following:

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The first line contains an integer T (1≤T≤$10^4$), denoting the number of test cases. The only line of each test case contains an integer n (2≤n≤$10^8$).

statement.title: Output
statement.content:
In fact, the answer can be represented as a fraction Q/P, where $gcd(P,Q)=1$ and P,Q>0. Since these numbers can be very huge for large n, you are only required to print $Q \cdot P^{-1}$ mod 998244353.

For each test case, print a single line with the calculated value.

statement.content:

1

Hint

Real answer for sample test cases are 1/2,1,5/6 respectively.
